description: Adding an additional superior court judge in Skagit county.

original.text:
Z-0253.1
HOUSE BILL 1144
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Lekanoff, Low, Ramel, Shavers, and Paul; by request of Administrative Office of the Courts
Prefiled 12/30/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Civil Rights & Judiciary.
AN ACT Relating to adding an additional superior court judge in Skagit county; and amending RCW 2.08.063.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
Sec. 1. RCW 2.08.063 and 2024 c 112 s 1 are each amended to read as follows:
There shall be in the county of Lincoln one judge of the superior court; in the county of Skagit, ((four))five judges of the superior court; in the county of Walla Walla, two judges of the superior court; in the county of Whitman, one judge of the superior court; in the county of Yakima, eight judges of the superior court; in the county of Adams, one judge of the superior court; in the county of Whatcom, five judges of the superior court.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The purpose of House Bill 1144 is to increase the number of superior court judges in Skagit County from four to five. This change is intended to improve the judicial capacity and efficiency in handling court cases within the county. The bill amends existing legislation to reflect this adjustment, addressing the growing need for judicial resources in the region.

Key Provisions

Judicial Positions

  • Increase the number of superior court judges in Skagit County from four to five.

subDocuments.name: 1144-S
subDocuments.description: Substitute House Bill 1144 as Recommended by Appropriations

original.text:
H-1336.1
SUBSTITUTE HOUSE BILL 1144
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByHouse Appropriations (originally sponsored by Representatives Lekanoff, Low, Ramel, Shavers, and Paul; by request of Administrative Office of the Courts)
READ FIRST TIME 02/13/25.
AN ACT Relating to adding an additional superior court judge in Skagit county; amending RCW 2.08.063; and creating a new section.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
Sec. 1. RCW 2.08.063 and 2024 c 112 s 1 are each amended to read as follows:
There shall be in the county of Lincoln one judge of the superior court; in the county of Skagit, ((four))five judges of the superior court; in the county of Walla Walla, two judges of the superior court; in the county of Whitman, one judge of the superior court; in the county of Yakima, eight judges of the superior court; in the county of Adams, one judge of the superior court; in the county of Whatcom, five judges of the superior court.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 2. If specific funding for the purposes of this act, referencing this act by bill or chapter number, is not provided by June 30, 2025, in the omnibus appropriations act, this act is null and void.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The edits made to the proposed legislation aim to clarify the number of superior court judges in Skagit County and introduce a provision regarding funding. The primary adjustments include an increase from four to five judges for Skagit County, aligning the bill with the county's judicial needs. Additionally, a new section has been added that stipulates that if the necessary funding is not allocated by a specified deadline, the act will become null and void. This addition is significant as it emphasizes the importance of funding in enacting the proposed changes.

Key Changes

Addition of a New Section

  • A new section (Sec. 2) has been included that states:
    • If specific funding for the purposes of this act is not provided by June 30, 2025, in the omnibus appropriations act, this act will be null and void.

Changes to Judicial Positions

  • The number of superior court judges in Skagit County has been revised:
    • The text change reflects an increase from four judges to five judges (indicated by the removal of "four" and the inclusion of "five").

These changes provide a clearer framework for the operations of the judicial system in Skagit County while ensuring that the implementation of the act is financially supported.

keywords.text: increase number superior court judges skagit county judicial capacity efficiency handling court cases judicial resources
